title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
2 point(s) earned: For a clear and complete method of estimating the focal length by focusing the image of the tree on a screen and stating that the distance between the image and the lens is the focal length

Partial credit:

1 point only was awarded if the method above was incomplete.

1 point only was awarded if the distances S0 (tree to lens) and S1 (lens to image) were measured or estimated, and then the numbers were used in the thin lens equation to calculate the focal length.
descriptions:

title: Part B & C
stimulusHtml:
1 point(s) earned: For showing a functional setup involving an object, the lens, and a screen

1 point(s) earned: For having the lens and the distances S0 and Si labeled correctly on the diagram

1 point(s) earned: For labeling on the diagram all the equipment checked in (b) (must have a functional setup to earn this point)
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

1 point(s) earned: For showing a functional setup involving an object, the lens, and a screen

1 point(s) earned: For having the lens and the distances S0 and Si labeled correctly on the diagram

1 point(s) earned: For labeling on the diagram all the equipment checked in (b) (must have a functional setup to earn this point)

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point(s) earned: For all data points from the table plotted correctly

1 point(s) earned: For a best-fit straight line (i.e., two points above and two points below the line and/or intercepts on axes close to 3.35 m-1)
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

1 point(s) earned: For all data points from the table plotted correctly

1 point(s) earned: For a best-fit straight line (i.e., two points above and two points below the line and/or intercepts on axes close to 3.35 m-1)

The student earns one of the following points:

1 point(s) earned: For all data points from the table plotted correctly

1 point(s) earned: For a best-fit straight line (i.e., two points above and two points below the line and/or intercepts on axes close to 3.35 m-1)

The student earns two of the following points:

1 point(s) earned: For all data points from the table plotted correctly

1 point(s) earned: For a best-fit straight line (i.e., two points above and two points below the line and/or intercepts on axes close to 3.35 m-1)

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
3 point(s) earned: For a clear and accurate solution with the correct answer in the range 0.28 m to 0.32 m with units

Partial credit:

2 points only were awarded for a mostly complete solution where either units were missing or it was unclear that the best-fit line was used (e.g., not using numbers from the best-fit line if Approach 1 was used, or not showing the idea of using the intercept if Approach 2 was used).

1 point only was awarded either for a correct answer with units where it was not clear how the answer was obtained, or for using the lens equation with data from the line where there was no final answer.
